result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald D Fuller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald D Fuller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald D Fuller was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Ronald D Fuller was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Anger Management counseling, and any other counseling ordered by agent.  
DISMISS Cts 1 & 2.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation terminated on 11-5-16; unpaid supervision fees of $180.30
from S.W.
Counts 3, and 4 added.

Defendant Ronald D Fuller in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended complaint filed by ADA Cross.  Waives reading.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Cts. 3 & 4.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Counts 1 & 2 dismissed.  Cts. 3 & 4;  court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  $443.00 costs each count for a total of $886.00 costs.  Anger management counseling and any other counseling ordered by agent.  Jail credit 2 days.   Bond on hand to be applied towards costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
